com.ibm.team.repository.common.query.ast
Interface IInListValueSource

public interface IInListValueSource

Interface that allows for passing in an arbitrarily large collection of literal input values at runtime, for query filtering as part of an in clause.

Generally, a database provider has limits to the number of input parameters that can be passed into a query. This API can be used by the caller when they know up front that the collection of values could be large enough such that it would exceed the platform limits. The query service will use an alternate path for query execution which may be slower than a typical in query, thus this should be used sparingly. Even with this API, callers should take precautions to ensure that the total number of input values is bounded. The server will be defensive and fail in the case of excessively large collections.

The iterator idiom is used to allow for streaming large collections without having to load all elements into memory.

Note: This is only supported server-side. Clients should not expect to use this interface to construct an AST query client-side and send it over the wire via an RPC call. It is expected that the caller will be a server side service that is also streaming the values, either from an http request stream or from the result of another query.

Since:
0.7
